intro: Rottlera longistipulata, commonly known as the long-stippled rottlera, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, opposite leaves with long, slender stipules. Its flowers are typically white or pale yellow, and it produces small, spherical berries. It is often found in moist, shaded areas of tropical forests.
